7DA5A09849BF4B90B9E663B9D9BF99C9.description: reflects on, analyzes, and assesses strategies used while learning Dene.

EB2642F80F97482EBB74030D190A77B2.description: determines personal inquiry and learning goals; and,

E315C5850FE84E3C99385D552826B18C.description: reflects on new knowledge of Dene and its value to self and the wider community;

D6A6D979CF7743B0A52F0519D1F4A079.description: determines personal inquiry and researches strengths and language goals;

03A7B7F553E34935B951A561AEDFB356.description: reviews, refines, through reflection, feedback and self-assessment;

6B2C86A56E0C4D2592553893AF6920CC.description: reflects on attainment of personal goals for effective language learning and use;

0E0D6FAF9AF5410CBA30F154987D70AF.description: assesses own and others' work for clarity, correctedness, and impact;

2F1FB47C40794F109CEC9E007A83A267.description: assess personal strengths and needs within the development of their own language learning as they relate to self, family and community and set goals for future improvement.

CB56DB38A27A49C0B740CD42171977EA.description: develops and uses criteria for evaluating self, goals, and projects.

FB89084DB79146E2B1D65E31BB2B4760.description: evaluates the quality of own contributions to group process and sets goals and plans for further development; and,

FAAF25387D7A4EEA9DEF98A94E1210D8.description: recognizes speaking, listening and viewing as useful tools to clarify thinking, communicating and learning;

A681A01DCEC141A98E9F21145E21AD91.description: reflects on and identifies through the Dene world-view and language;

0D50E7A27A594D4DB18CCDB7767B7C3A.description: assess personal strengths and needs within the development of their own language skill, and set goals for future improvement.

117A4847CB3B49D79E0FBE53CDAB5638.description: reflects on who they might approach to learn more about the Dene language.

0FD9DD7616D7423181A3DF8B6A3D4B28.description: reflects on what they might do on their own to learn more as a result of previous learnings; and,

55E84B2441CC4ED5928B9F46B5719618.description: reflects on what they learned reflects on what they would like to learn more about;

C6483846CCA943D5B649058FEEB06046.description: identifies with guidance what proficient Dene speakers do;

A47EA3EBE59D4144B65B40C264C2C2BB.description: assess personal strengths and needs as a Dene speaker and contributions made to the community of learners.

66798941E1124E53A5A4CAAF128E6EB4.description: retells a traditional moral narrative orally with a focus on developing the main character; e.g., his/her strengths and weaknesses, his/her dilemma, the problem, the resolution, the lesson.

D177D52BE9C940A796C4614DC2A4A3E1.description: gives advice; e.g., write a letter of advice to themselves, to a younger brother, to a cousin living away; and,

0A4CBB3F341D47EC9C5A6600CFB97CE6.description: gives reasons and information to support a point of view on an issue, such as the position taken on learning languages, the position taken on political involvement;

BFD5B7E6C43544A1A70ABDCB2D7F0AED.description: perform language functions that allow them to produce discourse.

858F37747F2F4FEBB71FBF5F965BD1BB.description: explores effective forms for recording and presenting or using research findings, such as incorporating technology, visual presentation, a magazine article, or written report.

D8FD295513464DCF836B88CCF6C09758.description: follows protocol for acknowledging sources; and,

86EDDDE06F6F4D599119546BD8FE73B8.description: prepares a report or presentation (written, visual, using technology);

13162F8CED774D18A597025D107A294A.description: organizes information in ways to fit the need or purpose of task;

ED67BB97C0754D2792C197053BF05FE5.description: practices and approaches cultural resource people with appropriate protocol for collecting information;

7A212853E5B649FC832DB685C807726B.description: identifies possible sources of information, including people, written texts and media texts;

235B879AA30342C9874BA50D65DF0A4B.description: consults with community Elders, and identifies a research need or purpose to gather information on the Dene culture;

C4B3CF05726146149FEC958933697EB5.description: perform language functions that allow them to research.

80E263D3A2FD4E4AA7ED35C0CD52B588.description: after hearing/viewing/reading discourse: demonstrates comprehension of main idea and details; demonstrates recognition of language techniques used for effectiveness of presentation; identifies examples of implied or indirect language; and examines purpose, such as hedging and avoidance; identifies the form of discourse chosen to match the purpose and audience, such as an interview, music, etc; identifies the dilemma or conflicts and resolution faced by the main character in moral stories. reflects on personal lessons learned from moral stories; and, identifies examples of puns and jokes; and examines their construct and purpose, such as gentle criticism, audience involvement.

D3C4EBF500DB4ED5BE6E46633A3FE75E.description: engages in previewing or hearing activities that orient students to the discourse, such as providing background knowledge, recalling what is already known;

15BE0067BFEA4548965705D5F51FEB8E.description: perform language functions that allow them to interpret discourse.

CED9F241AD8A43B1B703B17359D2D164.description: demonstrates and explains an understanding of special symbols and objects used during celebrations and ceremonies, including their meaning and foundation in traditional narratives.

A096BBC5251A427C9B58B7E33145FFFE.description: uses appropriate register at community events, such as introducing a speaker;

0CECFDF37BBF4150BB3C5FBF7857B867.description: carries on a simple conversation with another speaker, and uses appropriate register;

BD8379EBB9494808BD8F711DCBC8DFB7.description: appreciates the spontaneous humour in social situations;

A78ECE5C24934D83932CFD820AA90C51.description: perform language functions that allow them to socialize and celebrate.

261B4C1BAF074DF2AF1D639BFCA0B174.description: asks and answers questions using complete sentences.

7C6F4636EF7944888895C62B8F176EBC.description: exchanges ideas and thoughts on topics of personal interest; and,

C83F63C090F242A49EA0BC3FBC48DDB8.description: seeks, in discussions and group work, the input of those who are experienced in the area of discussion;

C0DA01DF6C8742849D0E7EC0174D0CEC.description: attempts to reformulate the ideas of others in discussions and group work to enable consensus;

73558BCF53C742C2A2755E286A0BFA7F.description: listens actively to others, in discussions and group work, and solicits and offers ideas;

5BC8486B6C904D0FB150D02CEFC80165.description: exchanges information and opinions about moral dilemmas and issues affecting them personally;

4DC79A491498434DA790F03F2677D0FD.description: perform language functions that allow them to get and give information.

8F37896185C04470B875F97F72017F5A.description: uses a wide range of interaction patterns to deal with routine and non-routine transactions and interactions.

E5A6007AD0574D68BABDD7CADF817CFE.description: uses the appropriate level of formality with people in a variety of contexts; and,

35891B33F56F4110A59B3D7BF4DD1075.description: adjusts language to suit audience and purpose;

14540DF2C03243B5A24D01024E79F651.description: uses sentences and questions that contain learned vocabulary and familiar language structures in different forms;

386D8660779F48D4A71799C238AA5CBB.description: uses linking devices throughout the discourse, though not with complete agreement;

E7205D172D4A45C29839480462D293E8.description: uses complex and compound sentences to hold ideas in discourse together;

6CA095AA3B7E417687BE82C7471FE90C.description: communicate meaningfully with coherency (coherency relates to the connectedness of information, thoughts and ideas within communication).

D0D3BBC4A2624289A8AE86D6F3FCEB7C.description: sustains conversations for up to 15 minutes.

8FA2C715D84F492EA032FB7680A0265B.description: listens to and reiterates what another speaker has said, though the listener may need passage repeated or explained; and,

3B0859177ED84D428573D535794C813E.description: communicates thoughts, ideas, and feelings for specific purposes and audiences through a variety of verbal and visual media;

7C7485C010AD4E9598D803BD08B1CBB7.description: produces a variety of lengthy texts on topics, providing details to support the main point;

2884E501BCAA4BAFBB29F078BF067299.description: produces several sentences of spoken, coherent discourse, with relative detail and precision, in spontaneous situations;

F76DF8FE3FF44A9BB41CE6F67FCFA204.description: communicate meaningfully with proficiency (proficiency involves the ease with which communication is expressed or received).

277986482424411EA7856F83B4D45BE5.description: reads factual texts or concrete information from a cultural study or prose that is relatively straightforward.

CEBA9A3F31AA420ABA1E9241B781DF69.description: uses understanding of the varying sound systems of different dialects to understand them better; and,

884E3234D4CC4326B07FE577243896A3.description: uses idioms, and basic and specialized vocabulary from course content, to communicate ideas;

E217BD1FA07241978DAEF755E075179F.description: uses complex sentences and phrases but not without error;

B1CB83E13CD645E58CD3DEAB4F10643E.description: creates a variety of basic sentences using accurate grammar;

DBA42B9E5F554BE9B01F0DE142EB54A9.description: communicate meaningfully with accuracy (accuracy is primarily the grammatical system of a language).

E06CE10724DE4F9DB394BE73DC3D1719.description: seeks help from Elders in Dene language and cultural learning.

339BA5B96C6A4A648D00408AB2E86FA8.description: uses a buddy system in learning Dene; and,

6F22F0C14C3D4415BE1AB3AE3E335E60.description: provides personal motivation for learning by rewarding self when successful;

5F4BA5C0A2A442E7B4B44F8F70FBD787.description: monitors own anxiety about learning tasks, and takes measures to lower it if necessary;

5040C6C1087B4AFD840BC1156470D2B8.description: asks follow-up questions to check for understanding;

DD213067622146ECB1F1B6190445A5DE.description: uses various strategies to resume and sustain conversation;

F74C28E999564C1A8DCEC5D4C28845F3.description: uses social interaction skills to enhance group learning tasks;

2DE00A2F2F884361B74337F859C65571.description: works with others to solve problems;

1555B2F65E2B4570B52EF36DE5136AD8.description: takes responsibility for planning, monitoring, and assessing own learning experiences;

DFCC164AA51F48FF8E1ECEBB1C17A142.description: reflects upon own thinking and learning processes;

5F25182CED9A474393F648C09FA71995.description: demonstrates awareness of own strengths and areas of improvement in Dene;

EA0EC80946FE4C2384FE8D5F937BAE8B.description: identifies own language learning needs and goals and organize strategies and procedures accordingly;

B0100CB774BB470987231AD5F976AEC1.description: uses previously acquired knowledge or skills to assist with a new learning task;

D3B7740747D54D11A120278100A1ACCF.description: seeks information through a network of sources including libraries, the World Wide Web, individuals, and agencies;

543D08186F3343709B0001506AD4FB8C.description: uses reference materials or a speaker to verify or help in difficult areas of language;

1535BCD368994DBA93CDE9261D9DBE76.description: seeks authentic language documents for research purposes;

D97E82A71A504D13BE0AF495E4DEBE8D.description: selects the best form in which to express intent in a given context;

F654042F4BF046C9B6BEF8D9034212CD.description: infers meaning, and then verifies by reading or asking questions when opportunities arise;

4B5A433AF98241C5BC3BD5129CF427C7.description: uses context clues to infer probable meanings of unfamiliar words;

7D73B87CB7984A0F929C9780BF3CB62E.description: seeks opportunities outside class to practise and observe Dene;

3EEA687895D44D26A59AD430D0C5FC3C.description: seeks information through a network of sources (e.g., libraries, internet, others, agencies);

0353032FE3D64B128C62A4F943BB70D4.description: records unknown words and expressions, noting their context and function;

764AF9B3F6B042C8B21966A439036ABE.description: Learners will select and use appropriate strategies to maximize learning and communication.

D1CC821B4FA34A8D85835ABC8F68E6C3.description: writes a narrative or other creative text; and accompanies it with a visual, kinaesthetic or oral presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience.

FEABFB1DBF4246E39CDA036427003A06.description: writes a factual report based on researched information; and accompanies the written report with a visual presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience, such as graphics, display, computer interactive program, video program; and,

B8DA6CDE19F740DE9AA6D6ACC146C3E8.description: researches and reports historical information relating to current issues, such as residential schooling as it relates to present problems;

80E7945DFEEC4ABA9FA4E7A2B8AB7B0B.description: shares personal reflections created such as a speech or a written text, in response to personal experiences or areas of cultural study;

938913ECF5114BF0BCF5E10AA9942813.description: retells oral narratives or shares own writing orally and in written form, with the aid of various mediums, such as dramatization, art, or displays;

1BCD31DD6C4349FD83AB7EF9ADEE08B7.description: Learners will produce language that is understandable to others.

FB81381A81E14E308829E2FA0B516AC7.description: translates text between a Dene language and another language.

07FF79891ECE472980D9F53BE269B4F7.description: reads and interprets informational text that may be unfamiliar but relevant to research needs of the student; and,

B7670442250A449E94A7E2E4EBF31564.description: reads and interprets text that has been transcribed from the oral tradition of Dene people on a topic that is familiar to the student (contemporary lifestyles, fishing, hunting);

861004965E0D44EC8F60446712C372F2.description: interprets contemporary reflections in various mediums that relate to cultural areas of study, such as documentaries on social problems in the community, theatre, magazine articles;

0EE97D61C7CF41659D805D3869B9804E.description: interprets and produces speeches with a variety of purposes, such as inspirational, political, tributes and guidance, with the help of Elders or other adults in the community;

D444F50EAD8B477F853A7BE1CFCEDD88.description: interprets and explains or invites a speaker to share traditional narratives of the people: histories, moral stories, songs, informational texts, inspirational speeches;

5FAEABDC636147B4A3F868B20425BD80.description: interprets and explains the proceedings of meetings regarding topics relevant to cultural areas of study, such as land claims, or chief and council meetings;

33161F1A86004A91B49E2EC973EF6ADA.description: understand and interpret language as a connected set of ideas expressed in sentences.

9C8CED5D02844AD1B23BD3F669889D25.description: interacts with a mentor on a project relating to the language and/or Dene world-view.

4F2356B9A0F2425D9601C535DE0D6B7B.description: interacts with members of the community in acts of service to the community, such as volunteering at Elders' homes or with long term care; and,

82C3E6E46D6C421E98C89BE099B4B28A.description: interacts with members of the community while participating in community events, such as wakes, Elders gatherings, meetings, and language festivals;

0FBA154137EA4FE19CE00CC80488247A.description: interacts with members of the community and Elders while participating in nature camps;

5FFA37D457E244E8B12ECB2D9ABC98F2.description: interacts with Elders or other adult members of the community to receive guidance or information about the history of the community in order to create a display of the information collected;

4BFC388FC9804C088F35753E262B7BC0.description: interacts with Elders or cultural resource people while researching or inquiring about cultural information;

2BC08BC99E3E433981F80356FE78C0A3.description: interacts with classmates or school personnel in decision-making meetings, such as student council, class meeting, group project;

E82297B38EC64E078A96EA7BBEB44342.description: discusses and promotes positive interactions and relationships in the school;

5AAC770CE9884F82BE1282A0E1960261.description: interacts with classmates, school staff and visitors;

1545E4D249C240D9B4E1B22C9DCBAEC9.description: participates actively in developing language and cultural skills during experiential learning opportunities, such as helping at community/cultural events, volunteering with day-care children, visiting and conversing with Elders in the community, planning cultural camps/activities;

01569E5C3A3041E7A72462ADC1635E49.description: seeks information to further understanding of Dene concepts from Elders and other knowledge keepers within the community;

4BCBEF7D00ED47C89B5E1B5B7E4B29C2.description: interacts with classmates in pairs or small groups to complete class projects in the Dene language;

42A0B42000FB404A820DF5645175810D.description: interacts with classmates and teacher during language learning activities;

53A24532C1DB4364A7C213A8F42E7BBB.description: view, interact, and experience the natural and constructed environments of their community.
